org.grails.plugin.vaadin.taglib
[Groovy] Class VaadinTagLib

java.lang.Object
  org.grails.plugin.vaadin.taglib.VaadinTagLib
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware
class VaadinTagLib

Vaadin tags prefixed with "v", for example <v:label>

Tags provided:

  • layout
  • location
  • horizontalLayout
  • verticalLayout
  • warning
  • error
  • table
  • column
  • form
  • field
  • label
  • link
Also provided are helper methods for creating Components, intended to be called directly from GSP code rather than in a tag:
  • createHorizontalLayout
  • createVerticalLayout
  • createTable
  • createForm
  • createLabel
  • createLink
Finally, there are additional methods for special situations:
  • confirm
  • commit
Authors:
Francis McKenzie

Property Detail

applicationContext

org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext applicationContext

column

groovy.lang.Closure column
Configuration tag for describing a column in a Vaadin Table

The column header should be specified as the body of the tag.

A column generator can be specified using the 'generator' attribute, which expects a Closure accepting an Item parameter. The item is the underlying data of a row in the table.

commit

groovy.lang.Closure commit
Helper method that returns a closure that can be used in the 'onclick' attribute of a GrailsButton

Commits the specified form object.

attr:
form REQUIRED The form to commit

confirm

groovy.lang.Closure confirm
Helper method that returns a closure that can be used in the 'onclick' attribute of a GrailsButton

Used to trigger a confirm yes/no popup window, e.g. before deleting a domain object.

attr:
message REQUIRED The confirmation message

createForm

groovy.lang.Closure createForm
Returns a new Vaadin Form

createHorizontalLayout

groovy.lang.Closure createHorizontalLayout
Returns a new Vaadin HorizontalLayout

createLabel

groovy.lang.Closure createLabel
Returns a new Vaadin Label

createLink

groovy.lang.Closure createLink
Returns a new custom GrailsButton

createTable

groovy.lang.Closure createTable
Returns a new Vaadin Table

createVerticalLayout

groovy.lang.Closure createVerticalLayout
Returns a new Vaadin VerticalLayout

error

groovy.lang.Closure error
Vaadin Window Notification with Error type

The message should be specified in the body of the tag.

field

groovy.lang.Closure field
Configuration tag for describing a field in a Vaadin Form

The field label should be specified as the body of the tag.

form

groovy.lang.Closure form
Vaadin Form tag

Fields should be configured using nested <v:form> tags

grailsApplication

java.lang.Object grailsApplication

horizontalLayout

groovy.lang.Closure horizontalLayout
Vaadin HorizontalLayout tag

Components to be added to the layout should be specified as nested elements.

label

groovy.lang.Closure label
Vaadin Label tag

The label message should be specified in the tag body.

layout

groovy.lang.Closure layout
Adds a GspLayout component with specified layout name.
attr:
name REQUIRED The name of the layout view

link

groovy.lang.Closure link
Custom GrailsButton tag

The button caption should be specified in the tag body.

attr:
icon The icon as a resource or path
attr:
onclick An closure expecting a 'dispatch' argument, used to manually trigger the link. Alternatively, simply return true from the closure to follow the link.

location

groovy.lang.Closure location
Adds the tag contents to the specified location in the parent custom layout.
attr:
name REQUIRED The name of the location in the parent custom layout

namespace

static java.lang.Object namespace

returnObjectForTags

static java.lang.Object returnObjectForTags

table

groovy.lang.Closure table
Vaadin Table tag

Columns should be configured using nested <v:column> tags

verticalLayout

groovy.lang.Closure verticalLayout
Vaadin VerticalLayout tag

Components to be added to the layout should be specified as nested elements.

warning

groovy.lang.Closure warning
Vaadin Window Notification with Warning type

The message should be specified in the body of the tag.

arg:
prompt The prompt for the popup window
arg:
